column5: description
Germany invades Poland on 1 September 1939; Britain and France declare war on Germany on 3 September 1939, starting WWII
1940: RAF defeats Luftwaffe in air campaign, preventing German invasion of Britain
1940-1941: Sustained German Luftwaffe bombing of London and other cities, causing widespread destruction and civilian deaths
1940: Nazi Germany invades and occupies France; Vichy regime established
1941: Japan attacks US naval base, bringing USA into WWII
1941-1945: Systematic Nazi genocide of 6 million Jews and millions of others in concentration camps
Normandy landings on 6 June 1944; Allied invasion of Nazi-occupied Western Europe

column2: End of World War II in Europe
column5: 1945: Germany surrenders in May (VE Day); atomic bombs on Japan lead to surrender in September (VJ Day)
National Health Service established in 1948, providing free healthcare to all
1947: India gains independence from Britain, end of British Empire in subcontinent
Queen Elizabeth II crowned in 1953, televised event watched by millions
1956: UK, France, and Israel invade Egypt over canal nationalization; major blow to UK global influence
ITV begins broadcasting in 1955, expanding television access
1957: Founding of European Economic Community (predecessor to EU) by six nations
1956: Uprising against Soviet control crushed by Red Army
Apollo 11 moon landing in 1969; first humans walk on Moon
Beatles rise to global fame from 1963, sparking Beatlemania and cultural revolution
1966 FIFA World Cup victory on home soil
1968: Student and worker protests in France lead to near-revolution and social changes
1968: Czechoslovak reforms crushed by Warsaw Pact invasion
UK joins European Economic Community in 1973
OPEC oil embargo causes shortages, inflation, and energy rationing
First female UK Prime Minister elected in 1979
1978-1979: Widespread strikes and industrial unrest
1975: End of Vietnam War; communist victory
1982: UK defeats Argentina in conflict over Falkland Islands
1985: Massive charity concerts for Ethiopian famine relief
1986: Major reforms transform London into global financial hub
1989: Symbolizes end of Cold War division of Europe
1986: Nuclear accident in Ukraine releases radiation across Europe
Tim Berners-Lee proposes and develops WWW at CERN in 1989-1991
1990: East and West Germany reunite after fall of Wall
Eurotunnel opens in 1994, linking UK to France by rail
Princess Diana dies in Paris car crash in 1997, massive public mourning
1998: Peace deal ends most violence in Northern Ireland Troubles
Al-Qaeda attacks on US on 11 September 2001; leads to War on Terror
2002: Euro currency launched in 12 EU countries (physical notes/coins)
7 July 2005: Islamist terrorist bombings on transport network kill 52
2007-2008: Banking collapse, recession, bailouts worldwide
2012 Summer Olympics hosted in London

column2: Royal Wedding of William and Catherine
column5: Prince William marries Catherine Middleton in 2011
2016: UK votes to leave the European Union (52% Leave)
2010-2012: Pro-democracy uprisings across Middle East and North Africa
Global pandemic declared in 2020; lockdowns, vaccines, millions of deaths
Queen dies in September 2022; Charles III becomes King
Full-scale invasion begins February 2022; ongoing conflict with global impacts

column1: You can copy-paste this directly into a CSV file (add a header row if needed: year_range
